name: European General Counsel Association
memberOrga: Members are individuals not organisations. Members are the Chief Legal Officers of major multinational European corporations. Membership is by invitation only.
goal:
The EGCA is a membership association for the Chief Legal Officers for major European multinational corporations. It's main objectives are to:
1.1 to promote the highest standards of legal service to major multinational European corporations;
1.2 to facilitate the exchange of views and experiences of best legal practice and legal developments of common interest to the Members
interests: Competition, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, External Relations, General and Institutional Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives: The EGCA meeting in June 2015 included a presentation on  the structure of the European Commission from a representative of Martin Selmayr
